content:
While it is impossible to know exactly how Rousseau felt about his actions and their impact on society, there are several indications that he remained committed to his beliefs throughout his life.

In his writings, Rousseau often refers to himself as a champion of individual freedom and the rights of the people, and he expressed a deep concern for the well-being of society as a whole. He believed that his ideas had the potential to transform society for the better and devoted much of his life to promoting his political and philosophical views.

Indeed, Rousseau's ideas had a profound impact on French and European society, influencing everything from the French Revolution to the early Romantic movement. His works continue to be studied and debated to this day, and his ideas continue to inspire scholars and thinkers in many different fields.

Overall, while Rousseau undoubtedly faced many challenges and obstacles in his pursuit of greater democracy and social equality, he remained a committed advocate for his beliefs throughout his life, and his impact on society continues to be felt to this day.
